fish.name: Koi Galaxy Betta
fish.description: A highly vibrant male Betta fish with a striking 'Koi' or 'Galaxy Koi' pattern. The fish displays a rich tapestry of colors with black and bright yellow body, interspersed with iridescent purple/violet patches and hints of light blue/teal. Large, flowing fins characteristic of a male Betta with spectacular color blending.

characteristics.body_color: Black and bright yellow with iridescent purple/violet patches
characteristics.fin_colors: Deep purple/violet, bright yellow, vivid teal/green/blue
characteristics.fin_type: Large flowing fins (Halfmoon or Super Delta variety)
characteristics.distinguishing_features: Koi/Galaxy pattern, large colorful fins, iridescent scales

aquarium_setup.water_parameters: Temperature 76-82°F, pH 6.5-7.5, soft to moderately hard water
aquarium_setup.heating: Heater required to maintain stable temperature

water_quality.water_conditioning: Use water conditioner to remove chlorine/chloramine
water_quality.testing: Regular testing for ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH
water_quality.substrate: Fine gravel or sand, avoid sharp edges

feeding.food_types: Betta pellets, bloodworms, brine shrimp, daphnia

environment.decorations: Live or silk plants, hiding places, smooth decorations
environment.tank_mates: No other male Bettas, peaceful community fish only
environment.resting_areas: Floating plants or leaves for resting

health.disease_prevention: Quarantine new fish, maintain clean water
health.signs_of_illness: Clamped fins, loss of color, lethargy, loss of appetite

fish.image_description: Vibrant Koi Galaxy Betta fish with colorful flowing fins in aquarium

fish.name: Iridescent Cichlids
fish.description: Multiple vibrantly colored, iridescent fish with elongated bodies and striking rainbow-like coloration. Fish display shimmering scales with pink, purple, blue, green, red, and orange colors. Long, flowing pelvic fins and prominent dorsal fins. Reddish-orange iris eyes.

characteristics.body_color: Iridescent pink, purple, blue, green, red, orange
characteristics.fin_colors: Rainbow spectrum with pink, blue, green, red stripes
characteristics.fin_type: Long flowing pelvic fins, prominent dorsal fins
characteristics.distinguishing_features: Iridescent scales, long flowing fins, reddish-orange eyes

aquarium_setup.water_parameters: Temperature 75-82°F, pH 6.5-7.5, soft to moderately hard

water_quality.testing: Regular testing for ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH
water_quality.substrate: Fine sand or gravel, natural appearance

feeding.food_types: Cichlid pellets, bloodworms, brine shrimp, vegetables
feeding.special_notes: Varied diet important for health and coloration

environment.tank_mates: Peaceful community fish, avoid aggressive species
environment.territory: Provide multiple territories and hiding spots

health.signs_of_illness: Loss of color, clamped fins, rapid breathing

fish.image_description: Multiple iridescent cichlids with rainbow colors and long flowing fins

fish.name: Blue and Red Betta
fish.description: A vibrant male Betta fish with deep iridescent blue body transitioning to rich purple towards the tail. Large, flowing fins displaying stunning gradient of deep red, magenta, purple, and blue colors. Halfmoon or Super Delta fin variety with expansive, rounded shape.

characteristics.body_color: Deep iridescent blue transitioning to rich purple
characteristics.fin_colors: Deep red, magenta, purple, blue gradient
characteristics.fin_type: Large flowing fins (Halfmoon or Super Delta)
characteristics.distinguishing_features: Blue-purple body, red-edged fins, large flowing fins

fish.name: Golden Angelfish
fish.description: A striking Angelfish with bright yellow/golden-orange head and upper body, transitioning to silvery-white mid-body. Irregular black markings and spots on body and fins. Tall, elongated dorsal fin and large fan-shaped anal fin with black patterns.

characteristics.fin_colors: Yellow/orange base, translucent white/light blue tips
characteristics.fin_type: Tall elongated dorsal fin, large fan-shaped anal fin
characteristics.temperament: Generally peaceful, may be territorial during breeding
characteristics.distinguishing_features: Golden head, black markings, tall fins, thread-like pelvic fins

aquarium_setup.tank_size: Minimum 30 gallons for single, 55+ for group
aquarium_setup.water_parameters: Temperature 75-82°F, pH 6.5-7.5, soft to moderately hard

water_quality.testing: Regular testing for ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH

feeding.food_types: Angelfish flakes, bloodworms, brine shrimp, vegetables
feeding.special_notes: Varied diet important for health and growth

environment.swimming_space: Open swimming areas with plant cover

health.signs_of_illness: Loss of color, clamped fins, rapid breathing

fish.image_description: Golden Angelfish with black markings and tall fins in aquarium

fish.name: Peach Cichlid with Red Eye
fish.description: A large, light-colored cichlid with soft pale orange/peach body and subtle horizontal banding. Most striking feature is the bright, intense red eye with dark pupil. Translucent fins with hints of blue, purple, and pink. Distinct red ventral fins.

characteristics.body_color: Soft pale orange/peach with horizontal banding
characteristics.fin_colors: Translucent with blue, purple, pink hints, red ventral fins
characteristics.distinguishing_features: Bright red eye, peach body, translucent fins

aquarium_setup.tank_size: Minimum 40 gallons for single, 75+ for group
aquarium_setup.water_parameters: Temperature 75-82°F, pH 6.5-7.5, soft to moderately hard

fish.image_description: Peach-colored cichlid with bright red eye and translucent fins in planted aquarium

fish.name: Blood Parrot Cichlid
fish.description: A plump, rounded fish with distinctive permanently open or downturned mouth giving it a unique 'beak-like' appearance. Soft, uniform light pink/peach body with subtle shading variations. Dark prominent eye with reddish iris. Spiky dorsal fin with iridescent blue/purple tips.

characteristics.body_color: Soft uniform light pink/peach with subtle shading
characteristics.fin_colors: Translucent with iridescent blue/purple tips, deeper reddish-pink lower fins
characteristics.fin_type: Spiky dorsal fin, fan-shaped pectoral fins
characteristics.distinguishing_features: Beak-like mouth, pink body, spiky dorsal fin

aquarium_setup.tank_size: Minimum 30 gallons for single, 55+ for group
aquarium_setup.water_parameters: Temperature 75-82°F, pH 6.5-7.5, soft to moderately hard

water_quality.testing: Regular testing for ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH

feeding.food_types: Cichlid pellets, bloodworms, brine shrimp, vegetables
feeding.special_notes: May have difficulty eating due to mouth shape

environment.tank_mates: Peaceful community fish, avoid aggressive species
environment.territory: Provide multiple territories and hiding spots

health.common_issues: Ich, fin rot, bacterial infections, mouth deformities
health.signs_of_illness: Loss of color, clamped fins, rapid breathing

special_care.feeding_assistance: May need smaller food particles due to mouth shape
special_care.water_quality: Excellent water quality essential due to hybrid nature
